snippet: The president-elect said his immigration priority was to deport up to three million undocumented immigrants rather than 11 million and that his border wall might be a fence in places....
abstract: Pres-elect Donald J Trump eases back on some of his hardest-line positions on immigration but reaffirms his intent to roll back abortion rights, taking to Twitter to lash out at critics; Trump's newly-energized social media salvo, unparalleled in history of presidential communication, hints of plans to carry confrontational style of speaking to Americans with him to White House, in effort to blunt impact of news organizations that do not openly affirm his views.
lead_paragraph: The president-elect said his immigration priority was to deport up to three million undocumented immigrants rather than 11 million and that his border wall might be a fence in places.

headline.main: Donald Trump Appears to Soften Stance on Immigration, but Not on Abortion
headline.print_headline: On Immigrants and Abortion, and on Twitter
